name: Woodenbridge Hotel & Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had the pleasure of stayin one nite in this hotel...room wit view of golfcourse which was lovely,lovely dinner n drinks in bar.one thing i had problem with was on arrival,we were just signed in,told where room was n that was it...no"have lovely time r enjoy ur evening"......same when we checked out,no"did u enjoy r was everything ok"......other than that i would recommend the hotel n have done so 2my friends
reviews.title: beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate here on two nights. the food is good and reasonably priced (about the cheapest we had while away) The service on the second night was really slow, (at least two other couples who had ordered after us were served before us and we had to speak to a waiter to see where our food was) and when our meal eventually arrived the plates were so hot we could not touch them and the food was equally hot and we had to wait for it to cool a bit. Our suspicion was that they had actually forgotten the order and had had to reheat it quickly to get it to us. having said that, the waiters were friendly and helpful, but on both nights we noticed a change in waiters between thr order and food being brought out and wondered if this contributed to the delay in our meals. Despite this we would still recommend this as a place to eat,
reviews.title: good food

reviews.text: I just can't say enough nice things about Woodenbridge. The location is gorgeous, the staff and locals are so friendly and the food is mouth watering.
reviews.title: Beautiful Country Hotel.....excellent wedding venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister had her wedding her, we had the best day possible.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: The hotel has a cosy homely feel to it, and I love all the memorabilia on the walls.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in July. The location of the hotel and that of the surrounding areas are simply stunning, a real hidden gem in Ireland.
reviews.title: Lovely Location, Shame about the Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel however was very disappointing. Everything about the decor both in the rooms, hallways and bar/restaurant were outdated and grubby. We were staying in the 'new' part of the hotel so thought we would have a nice room. However when we walked into our non-smoking room the smell of smoke was overpowering. It was so strong I can not believe that housekeeping could even think to list the room as ready to be occupied. The room was fitted with a tiny TV (11-13 inches) which simply did not work. The bathroom toiletries were also particularly cheap. The curtains did not keep the light out meaning a bad nights sleep for me as I am a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service

reviews.text: Finally, a real mark of a bad hotel in my book, when I went to make a cup of tea there was old water in the kettle. God knows how long that was there. and if that was neglected what else was.
reviews.title: Poor

reviews.text: I'd love to go back to the area and go for a few nice hill walks. But I certainly won't stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: woodenbridge hotle&lodge

reviews.text: We went for a Family meal in this wonderful hotel recently. I rang ahead to check would they be able to cater for us as we were a large group of 11 adults and 4 children. Considering it was a busy Sunday afternoon they set up a table for us within the hour and from the moment we arrived all the staff were brilliant. If your looking for fantastic service with a smile and quality food then drop in to the Woodenbridge Hotel & Lodge if your in the area. I know we certainly will in the future.
reviews.title: Charm, character and excellent value for money

reviews.text: Got a good last minute DBB deal directly with the hotel.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel in terrific location , a little dated,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of the hotel is idyllic, overlooking the golf course and the Wicklow mountains behind.
reviews.title: Make sure you stay in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall our stay was most enjoyable, lovely traditional Irish bar and good restaurant. Bedroom was lovely, bathroom a little dated,but very clean and I understand upgrades are being done.
reviews.title: Great Weekend in Woodenbridge

reviews.text: Baby friendly hotel, but note there are no lifts to the second floor. Bar food was very good, excellent service and same could be said for the restaurant..probably 7/10 for the food..
reviews.title: Come for the scenery, enjoy the people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty good, not a great choice, but your typical fare.
reviews.title: OK...ish

reviews.text: We had a great stay at a friends wedding here, they were very friendly from arrival to departure and the staff even remembered our names. It is this attention to detail that makes a Hotel rememberable. We would receommend and will be back, (Have the steak and the house Red).
reviews.title: truly beautiful scenery and welcoming staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and it was a wonderful night. The hotel, one of the oldest in Ireland, was tucked away from the hustle and bustle. Our room had nice balcony with a view of the golf course. We ate dinner at the pub and the food was excellent. You could tell that they just put new carpet in the room. However, the bathroom was in some need of repair. Overall, it was a wonderful hotel. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Woodenbridge is a wonderful place, nestled in beautiful scenery. We stayed there as it is a great starting place for walks. We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel, far away from the city slicker life. This is a family run hotel, with lots of attention to detail and the best Irish hospitality can offer (we got plenty of tips for trips around the area). Our rooms had beautiful views (the views are truly magnificent) across the countryside and were spotlessly clean. I also liked the charming interior (not a big fan of soulless standard hotel rooms), it was very tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: A hidden gem
Excellent hotel, very friendly staff and beautiful location
reviews.text: Thumbs up also on the food, we had several dinners in the hotel, which all were seasonal and delicious (and mostly locally sourced).
This little hidden gem might not be for everyone, but for those who want to experience real Irish hospitality and fab home-cooked food.
reviews.title: Not up to 3* hotel standard

description: Situated in the vale of Avoca, one of Ireland’s most beautiful locations, and established in 1608, Woodenbridge hotel is the oldest hotel in Ireland and one of the few remaining family-run hotels. The hotel itself overlooks the vale of Avoca and the amazing Woodenbridge golf club, while Woodenbridge lodge is adjacent to the main hotel and is surrounded by peaceful gardens on the banks of the Aughrim River. All of the rooms are en-suite and with complimentary wireless access.
